dt: {bc}to present, advocate, or demand earnestly or pressingly

dt.t: his conviction was upheld on a theory never {it}urged{/it} at his … trial

dt: {bc}to undertake the accomplishment of with energy, swiftness, or enthusiasm
{bc}to serve as a motive or reason for
{bc}to force or impel in an indicated direction or into motion or greater speed

dt.t: the dog {it}urged{/it} the sheep toward the gate

dt: {bc}to declare, advance, or press earnestly a statement, argument, charge, or claim

dt.t: {it}urged{/it} for the adoption of the proposal

shortdef: to present, advocate, or demand earnestly or pressingly
to undertake the accomplishment of with energy, swiftness, or enthusiasm
